Title: Interfax-Ukraine to host press conference on Summit 'Challenges o...

The event will be held under the organization and initiative of Kyiv Agrarian University of the National Academy of Agrarian Sciences of Ukraine and SOE Center for Forensic Examination and Expert Research of the State Judicial Administration of Ukraine. Participants include Professor, PhD in Economics, Vice-Rector of Kyiv Agrarian University of the National Academy of Agrarian Sciences of Ukraine Innola Novikova; forensic expert, PhD in Law, director of SOE Center for Forensic Examination and Expert Research of the State Judicial Administration of Ukraine Ihor Starodubov; scientist, PhD in Law, president of Win Experts group of companies Viktor Leschynsky; head of the logistics department of the Agrosem agricultural company Dmytro Lynnyk; moderator: political observer, TV presenter, honored journalist of Ukraine Serhiy Doiko (8/5a Reitarska Street). The event will be streamed the Interfax-Ukraine YouTube channel. Admission requires registration on the spot with press ID cards.

Title: SBU, Special Forces' drones hit Andreapol oil pumping station, mi...

Title: Russian oligarch Deripaska's assets worth UAH 2.11 bln seized in ...
Description: Based on materials from the Security Service of Ukraine, the court has seized a large batch of industrial products and raw materials owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.

Title: Sybiha: In global competition age, EU must be competitive, it nee...
Description: In an age of global competition, the EU must be competitive, and for this, it needs Ukraine with its army, technology, and people, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andriy Sybiha has said.

Title: Ukrainian, Croatian PMs agree to hold joint govt meetings in 2025

Title: Restoration of Pediatric Cardiology Center affected by Russian at...

Description: Mykola Tochytsky, the Minister of Culture and Strategic Communications of Ukraine, met with UNESCO Director-General Audrey Azoulay to discuss solutions for addressing the shortage of restorers and specialists needed for evacuation of cultural heritage.

Title: Kyiv parks shrink by 800 ha in ten years – ecologist
Description: KYIV. Jan 29 (Interfax-Ukraine) – Director of Kyiv Ecological and Cultural Center Volodymyr Boreiko said that, according to a survey conducted by the center, Kyiv parks have shrunk by 800 hectares over the past decade, and Kyiv City Council failed to establish a single nature reserve in 2024.

Title: Croatia preparing new package of military-technical assistance fo...
Description: Croatia is preparing a new package of military-technical assistance for Ukraine, Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal said.

Title: Early booking of tours to Greece by bus to the sea with ANEX Tour...
Zelenskyy honors memory of Heroes of Kruty
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy took part in a flower-laying ceremony at the memorial cross to the Heroes of Kruty at Askold's grave in Kyiv.

Title: Finland develops extended-range drone for Ukraine

Title: Defense forces hit ammunition depot, seven areas of invaders’ con...

Description: Over the past day, 193 military clashes have been recorded. This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Telegram in operational information on the Russian invasion as of 8:00 on Wednesday.

Title: PACE resolution on threat from PMCs is powerful signal for all co...
Description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine welcomes the adoption of the resolution by the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE), which raises urgent issues regarding the activities of private military and security companies (PMSCs), mercenaries, and other non-State actors involved in military operations, the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.

Description: On Tuesday, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a meeting of the Supreme Commander's Staff Headquarters, among the issues that were considered was the formation of corps in the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: US military aid for Ukraine continues - Center for Countering Dis...
Description: Head of the NSDC's Center for Countering Disinformation, Andriy Kovalenko, denied information about the alleged termination of military assistance to Ukraine from the United States.

Title: Russia intensifying its campaign of sabotage against European NAT...
Description: NATO acknowledged that Russia is escalating a sabotage and destabilization campaign against European NATO member states to deter further military assistance to Ukraine, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) notes in an analytical report for January 28.

Title: Fico chooses Moscow – Zelenskyy responds to accusations of Slovak...

Title: URCS helps victims of Russian attack on Odesa
Description: The Ukrainian Red Cross Society (URCS) helped victims of the Russian morning massive drone attack on Odesa.

Title: Pokrovsk direction remains hottest on front - Khortytsia group of...
Description: Heavy defensive battles are continuing in Pokrovsk direction of the front, the press service of the Khortytsia operational-strategic group of forces reports.

Title: Ukraine to receive Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets from France before ...

Shashin (Tatneft), Deputy Minister Inna Bohatykh reported on Facebook.

They discussed continued support for Ukraine and possible forms of security guarantees for Ukraine.

Title: Khortytsia group: Main direction of occupiers' efforts remains Po...

Description: Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Andriy Sybiha thanked EU colleagues for their important decision to extend sanctions against Ukraine.

For additional information, call: (093) 876 5890 (Hanna Kotenko).

Description: The European Union has provided energy security guarantees to Hungary, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said.

Description: The EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Kaja Kallas reports that the foreign ministers of the EU member states have again decided to extend sanctions against Russia.

Description: Counteracting hybrid threats from Russia and developing economic partnership were discussed by Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal and Moldovan President Maia Sandu during a meeting in Kyiv on Saturday.

Title: Putin signals he not interested in peace without his demands bein...
Description: Vladimir Putin continues to signal to both his domestic and global audiences that he is not interested in peace without his full demands being met and remains committed to Ukraine's complete capitulation, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) said.

Title: Zelenskyy signs decree banning talks in Oct 2022 to stop separati...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed a decree of the National Security and Defense Council in October 2022 banning any negotiations with Russia in order to stop separatism in Ukraine.

Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy discussed with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in Davos the issue of using Ukrainian infrastructure to transport Azerbaijani gas if Europe needs it.

Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Moldovan President Maia Sandu issued a joint statement after talks in Kyiv, in which they noted the current aspects of bilateral and international cooperation between the two countries, the President's Office of Ukraine said on Saturday.

Description: The United States did not suspend military aid to Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy commented on the signing by U.S. President Donald Trump of an executive order to suspend foreign aid programs for 90 days.

Description: Ukraine may send specialists to service Moldova State District Power Plant, which is located on the left bank of the Dniester, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

Title: Zelenskyy, Sandu discuss support for Ukraine, Moldova
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Moldovan President Maia Sandu discussed support for Ukraine and Moldova during their talks in Kyiv.

Title: European Solidarity MPs petition for General Halushkin's release ...

Title: Moscow's goodwill can be generated by superior firepower and crus...

Description: PJSC Ukrnafta is working on energy generation projects using its own gas, with a total planned capacity of up to 370 MW.

Description: (Participants list has been updated)

Title: Yermak: Putin seeks to talk about Ukraine without Ukraine, this n...
Description: Vladimir Putin is trying to promote the idea of ​​​​negotiations with the United States, but seeks to talk about Ukraine without Ukraine's participation, this will not happen, Head of the President's Office Andriy Yermak said.

Title: On January 31, Kyiv will host a forum for agribusiness managers
Interfax-Ukraine to host press conference 'Private medicine in Uk...
Description: On Thursday, January 30, at 12.00, the press center of the Interfax-Ukraine News Agency will host a press conference titled 'Private medicine in Ukraine: Three years of war and further challenges.' Participants include Director of Smart Medical Center, Chairman of the Association of Private Healthcare Institutions of Ukraine Olena Yeschenko; Deputy General Director of Synevo Ukraine Mykola Skavronsky; Medical Director of the Dobrobut healthcare network Oleksandra Mashkevych; Operational Director of Leleka maternity hospital Vadym Zukin; Director of Aneli Medical and Diagnostic Center Olena Afanasieva; Director of Garvis health center Vitaliy Bereznytsky (online); Medical Director of Odrex health center Dmytro Havrychenko (online) (8/5a Reitarska Street). The event will be streamed the Interfax-Ukraine YouTube channel. Admission requires registration on the spot with press ID cards.

Title: War in Ukraine approaching 'turning point,' Turkey ready to suppo...
Description: The Russian war against Ukraine is approaching a 'turning point,' Turkey is ready to support initiatives to resume the peace negotiations, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan has said.

Title: European Commission sends Council first screening report within E...
Description: The European Commission sent the first screening report Cluster 1 Fundamentals for Ukraine to the European Council for the further discussion with Member States.

Title: Former command of 155th Anne de Kyiv Brigade put draft dodgers on...
Description: The former command of the 155th Separate Mechanized Brigade assisted draft dodgers in crossing the state border under the pretense of being Ukrainian soldiers traveling for military training in France, Adviser to the State Bureau of Investigations (SBI) Tetiana Sapyan said on Friday.

Title: Female Veterans: Adaptation Through Lens of Gender Needs
Description: As Ukraine enters the third year of russia's full-scale invasion, the number of demobilized soldiers continues to rise. Currently, there is a lack of government programs specifically targeting the needs of women returning from the army, despite their growing presence in the Armed Forces. Approaches to social and psychological reintegration are universal and fail to address the unique challenges women face when adapting to civilian life. These difficulties are driven by differences in societal expectations, gender roles and the distinct experiences gained during and after the war.

Title: Bodies of 757 fallen defenders repatriated to Ukraine – Coordinat...
Description: The bodies of 757 fallen defenders have been repatriated to Ukraine, the Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War said on Friday.

Title: Sybiha: With lower oil prices, higher sanctions pressure, Russian...
Description: The lower the oil prices and the higher the sanctions pressure, the less fuel for the war machine in Moscow, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Andriy Sybiha has said Friday.

Title: Ukraine's MFA about Russia's ultimatum to NATO: Utter bullshit
Description: Spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Heorhiy Tykhy has retorted sharply to Russia's ultimatum that one of the key elements for ending the war was to cancel NATO's promise of Ukraine's future membership, made at the 2008 Bucharest summit.

Title: DTEK ready to help Moldova ensure energy stability - CEO
Description: DTEK energy holding is ready to help Moldova ensure its energy stability, said its CEO Maksym Timchenko following a meeting with Moldovan Prime Minister Dorin Recean on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Title: Stefanchuk welcomes Luxembourg Parliament resolution on human rig...
Description: The resolution of the Luxembourg Parliament condemning Russia for human rights violations against Crimean Tatars during the illegal occupation of Crimea is an important step towards holding those responsible accountable, says Verkhovna Rada Chairman Ruslan Stefanchuk.

Title: Interfax-Ukraine to host briefing 'Improving palliative care at p...
Description: On Wednesday, January 29, at 15.00, the press center of the Interfax-Ukraine News Agency will host a briefing on the results of the program 'Strengthening the capacity of primary health care institutions to provide palliative care in Chernihiv, Sumy and Dnipropetrovsk regions,' implemented within the project Support for Health Care Reform.

Title: Defense forces destroy 25 enemy UAVs – Ukraine's Air Force
Description: On the night of January 24, Russian occupiers attacked the territory of Ukraine with 58 Shahed-type attack UAVs and drone imitators of various types, the Air Force command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports.

Title: Ukraine's General Staff confirms strikes on Ryazan Oil Refinery, ...
Description: The Security Service of Ukraine and the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine conducted a joint operation on the night of January 24, 2025, striking objects involved in providing support to the Russian occupation army.

Title: Zelenskyy appoints Olha Kuryshko as permanent presidential rep in...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed Olha Kuryshko from the post of deputy representative of the president in Crimea and appointed her to the post of permanent representative in the Autonomous Republic of Crimea.

Title: Interpipe invests total of $83 mln in improving product quality, ...
Description: The Ukrainian industrial company Interpipe has invested $83 million in improving product quality and new production lines in almost three years of the full-scale war.

Title: For Ukraine, OECD membership no less important than EU, NATO one ...
Description: Ukraine is determined to move forward on the path of implementing reforms to gain membership in the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), which is no less important than NATO and EU membership, said Deputy Head of the President's Office Ihor Zhovkva during a meeting with OECD Director for Eurasian Affairs William Thomson.

Title: Europe expects USA to provide troops for peacekeeping mission in ...
Description: European officials are seeking commitments from the new administration of US President Donald Trump to participate in security guarantees for Ukraine, including in the format of peacekeeping troops, Bloomberg reports.

Title: Zelenskyy on shelling of Kyiv region: Russia would not be able to...
Description: Russia would not have been able to fight if the ability of Russian allies to help this terror had been really limited, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy responded to the night shelling of Kyiv region.

Title: Kremniy plant in Bryansk attacked by drones for third time - CCD
Description: In the Russian city of Bryansk, the Kremniy plant has been attacked by drones for the third time. It produces microelectronics for missile systems and other military equipment, in particular for Iskanders and drones, said Andriy Kovalenko, head of the Center for Countering Disinformation (CCD) of the National Security and Defense Council.

Title: Ukraine welcomes decisions of Syrian authorities aimed at refusin...
Description: Ukraine welcomes the cancellation by the Syrian authorities of the investment agreement with the Russian side on Russia's use of the seaport of Tartus.

Title: Syrsky: We need to prepare not only for defense, but also for off...
Description: The Kursk operation significantly motivated both the personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) and society, and it will not be the last, said Oleksandr Syrsky, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: We’ll work on other govt programs, now it’s important to support ...
Description: More than 12 million Ukrainians have applied under the e-Support program, and work will be carried out on other government programs, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said following a report by Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal.

Title: Zelenskyy announces coordination of intl work
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy held meetings on Thursday and reported on the coordination of international work, primarily in the United States and Europe.

Title: Yermak-McFaul group supports Trump's desire to lower oil prices
Description: Yermak-McFaul sanctions group supports U.S. President Donald Trump's desire to lower oil prices, since then Russia will not be able to finance the war, Head of the President's Office of Ukraine Andriy Yermak said.

Title: Trump hopes China will help him end the war in Ukraine
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has said that he always liked Chinese President Xi Jinping, and expressed hope for China's help in the peaceful settlement of Russia's war against Ukraine.
